body:
What version of Windows? Do you have any versions of Visual Studio installed?

I am wondering if we should remove the pre-requisite. It is probably unlikely that a .NET developer would attempt to install and run NUnit on a machine without NUnit. Otherwise, we will need to look at the pre-requisite and try to figure out why it is failing. Likely because 2.0 isn't installed?

Take a look in your registry under at key HKLM\Software\Microsoft.NETFramework\Policy\v4.0. There should be an entry with name 30319. Do you have that? If not, what is there? And what other keys do you have under Policy?

@rprouse 
Windows 10 64-bit.

I have Visual Studio Community 2015, the express edition of Visual C++ 2008 and 2010 and Visual Studion Express 2013.

I don't have .NET 2 installed.

@CharliePoole 
I have HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft.NETFramework\policy\v4.0 with the value: 30319-30319

Under policy I have AppPatch, Servicing, Standards, Upgrades, v2.0 and v4.0.

That's what you should have - it's what I have, for example.

@rprouse is it possible this works differently on Windows 10?

I have two Windows 10 64-bit machines and it installs fine for me. I see the same things in the registry as @brunoqc and it looks the same as my Win8.1 machine. The only difference I can think of is that I have .NET 2.0 installed.

Can you create a package where 4.0 is required (not 2.0) and see if that
installs?

On Tue, Oct 27, 2015 at 10:26 AM, Rob Prouse notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I have two Windows 10 64-bit machines and it installs fine for me. I see
> the same things in the registry as @brunoqc https://github.com/brunoqc
> and it looks the same as my Win8.1 machine. The only difference I can think
> of is that I have .NET 2.0 installed.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/939#issuecomment-151577828.
@brunoqc, you mentioned that you have a a v2.0 node under HKLM\Software\Microsoft.NETFramework\policy, is there a 50727 key under that?

@brunoqc, I am putting status confirm on this because I am not able to reproduce on any of my Win10 machines, so I don't think this should hold up the release. Unfortunately I don't have any clean VM's to test on.

You mention uninstall in the issue. Did this happen uninstalling beta 5 so that you could re-install clean? Can you remember the steps you took to help us reproduce?

Yes I'm trying to reinstall nunit.

I tried to install it a couple of minute before and I wasn't paying much attention. I don't know if the installation failed (I don't see the install path in the installer to confirm) or not so I'm trying to reinstall.

Right now when I start the installer I have the "Change", "Repair" and "Remove" buttons and pressing on any of them results in the .NET requirement problem.

You are the man @brunoqc, I can now reproduce.
1. Install NUnit.3.0.0-beta-5.msi
2. Run the installer again and attempt to repair or uninstall.

For your information, NUnit is installed on your machine. You can find it in C:\Program Files (x86)\NUnit.org

If you want to uninstall, doing so from add/remove programs works.
